Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class for UDP socket communication that can be used for both sending and receiving datagram packets. The class should handle socket creation, binding, message transmission, and reception with proper error handling.

Class Description: HTTPUSocket is a UDP socket wrapper class that provides simplified methods for UDP communication. It manages socket lifecycle and provides methods for sending messages to specific addresses and receiving incoming packets.

Attributes:
- ssdpUniSock: DatagramSocket - The underlying UDP socket for communication
- localAddr: String - The local address bound to the socket

Methods:
- HTTPUSocket() -> void - Default constructor that creates an unbound UDP socket
- HTTPUSocket(String bindAddr, int bindPort) -> void - Constructor that binds socket to specific address and port
- HTTPUSocket(int bindPort) -> void - Constructor that binds socket to specific port on all interfaces
- getDatagramSocket() -> DatagramSocket - Returns the underlying DatagramSocket instance
- setLocalAddress(String addr) -> void - Sets the local address manually
- getLocalAddress() -> String - Returns the local address bound to the socket
- open() -> boolean - Creates an unbound UDP socket, returns success status
- open(String bindAddr, int bindPort) -> boolean - Binds socket to specific address and port, returns success status
- open(int bindPort) -> boolean - Binds socket to specific port on all interfaces, returns success status
- close() -> boolean - Closes the socket, returns success status
- post(String addr, int port, String msg) -> boolean - Sends a message to specified address and port, returns success status
- receive() -> SSDPPacket - Receives an incoming packet and returns it wrapped in SSDPPacket object
